OptionalParams.ParamDescription: The event stop time, if any, in ISO 8601 format (see above).
The event timezone, as listed in the Olson timezones database (e.g. "America/New_York")
True ("1") if the event is an all-day event, false ("0") otherwise.
The event description.
The privacy setting for this event. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private)
A space-delimited list of tags.
True ("1") if the event is free, false ("0") otherwise.

A text string describing the event price.  For example, this could indicate a pricerange ("$15 - $35"), free but donations requested ("$10 donation suggested"), or otherspecial instructions ("Adults $15, children under eight $5").  Don't pass this parameteror leave it blank if there is no price information.
The ID of this event's parent event.

RequiredParams.ParamDescription: This method requires user authentication.
The event title.

The event start time in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00") or a  readable alternative (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). See the W3C Note on Date and Time formats for examples or RFC3339 for more detail.  Note that if offset information is specified here (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00-04:00"), the time will be converted to UTC.  The preferred method of specifying the time zone is via the tz_olson_path parameter (below).
The ID of the venue where this event occurs.  Use /venues/new or /venues/search retrieve an appropriate ID.

ServiceDescription: Add a new event record.

RequiredParams.ParamDescription: This method requires user authentication.
The id of the requested event.

ServiceDescription: Restore a withdrawn event.

OptionalParams.ParamDescription: The search keywords.

Limit this list of results to a date range, specified by label or exact range.  Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g.  "October". Exact ranges can be specified the form 'YYYYMMDD00-YYYYMMDD00', for example '2012042500-2012042700'; the last two digits of each date in this format are ignored.
Limit the search results to this category ID. A list of categories may be specified separated by commas. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs.
Exclude search results from including this category ID. A list of categories may be specified separated by commas. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs.

If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius.  If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored.
One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi".
If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will bereturned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result.
One of 'popularity', 'date', or 'relevance'.  Default is 'relevance'.
One of 'ascending' or 'descending'.  Default varies by sort_order.
The desired number of results per page.
The desired page number.
A comma separted list of image_sizes desired. See Faq for list of possible image sizes.
Return our guess of each event language. ("Undetermined" is a possibility)

Sets the level of filtering for events marked as "mature" due to keywords in the title or description. One of 'all' (no filtering), 'normal', or 'safe'. 'Normal' mature filtering consists of words that are clearly profanities and inappropriate for younger audiences. 'Safe' mature filtering consists of all normal mature filtered words, as well as other terms that may be used as inappropriate innuendo. A 'safe' filter may eliminate events that are benign in nature, but contain questionable content based on keywords. Defaults to 'all'.

Indicates that optional sections should be included in the result XML. Multiple section names can be indicated, separated by commas (e.g. 'categories,links'). Sections include 'categories', 'subcategories', 'popularity', 'tickets', 'price', and 'links'.

If set changes the start_date of long duration events (lasting multiple days) to the beginning of the search date range. It will also give the next occurence of a recurring event after the start range.  This will prevent an event from appearing to be outside the date range requested .

RequiredParams.ParamDescription: This method controls access via authentication.

A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122") and venue IDs ("V0-001-000268633-5").  Common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is

ServiceDescription: Search for events.

OptionalParams.ParamDescription: The search keywords.

A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122").  Full addresses ("1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, CA") and common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius.

Limit this list of results to the specified date range.  Date ranges are specified by label.  Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g.  "October".

If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius.  If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored.
One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi".
One of 'popularity', 'date', 'title', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'.  Default is 'date'.
One of 'ascending' or 'descending'.  Default varies by sort_order.
The desired number of results per page. Default: 50, Maximum: 50.
